description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2bdtf","text":"Background: Ficus deltoidea L. Jack is a folk medicinal plant known for its pharmacological properties, including anti-inflammatory, anticancer, and anti-angiogenic. This study aimed to evaluate the anti-angiogenic properties of silver nanoparticles biosynthesized using F. deltoidealeaf extract (AgNPs-Fd).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":12,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":271,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epvnk","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm2b","text":"Methods: The AgNPs-Fd were synthesized by mixing 100 mL 1 mM aqueous silver nitrate (AgNO3) and 100 mL 0.1%F. deltoidea ethanolic leaf extract. The resulting AgNPs-Fd were observed for color change and Tyndall effects. Reaction mixture color change from pale brown to reddish brown was observed at 48 h at 37℃oC. The characterization of AgNPs-Fd was completed with UV–Vis spectroscopy, transmission electron microscopy (TEM), X-ray diffraction (XRD) and Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy. For quantitative analysis of the vascular network in thechorio allantoic membrane(CAM) assay, AngioTool open-source software was used.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7},{"style":"sub","offset":89,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":107,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":558,"length":25},{"style":"sup","offset":309,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qu24","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecqa7","text":"Results:The plasmon resonance peak for AgNPs-Fd at 430 nm was visible in the UV-Visible spectrum, indicating the formation of AgNPs-Fd. TheF. deltoidea extract and nanoparticles interacted well according to FTIR analysis. The AgNPs-Fd morphology of 20 nm particle sizes was observed using TEM. The chromatographic analysis of AgNPs-Fd identified potential anti-angiogenic compounds, such as phytol, stigmasterol, lupeol, and sitosterol. The angiogenic inhibition properties of AgNPs-Fd were tested using the CAM assay. The 90mg dose AgNPs-Fd treatment in CAMs demonstrated significant anti-angiogenesis, indicating effectiveness in controlling vessel formation.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":139,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3a0o","text":"Conclusion: The present study suggests that eco-friendly work and the “green” process of AgNPs-Fd is potentially applicable for nanobiotechnology in anti-angiogenic fields.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuore","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"885kr","text":"Keywords:anti-angiogenic;Ficus deltoidea; green synthesize; nanomaterials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6t9li","text":"Aqueous silver nitrate (AgNO3) (100 mL, 1 mM) was combined with 100 mL 0.1%F. deltoidealeaf extract.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":28,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":75,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26cgd","text":"To determine phytochemicals surrounding the AgNPs-Fd, FTIR spectroscopy (Agilent, Cary 630 model, US) was performed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vss9","text":"The TEM (MIRA3 model, Czech Republic) was operated to display the surface morphology of the AgNPs-Fd. XRD was applied to evaluate the chemical characterization of AgNPs-Fd","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90vcl","text":"The resulting AgNPs-Fd were confirmed using UV-Vis spectrophotometry (Shimadzu, UV-1280, Japan) in the range of 350–750 nm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6s0l8","text":"The pH of the solution was adjusted to 7.0, and it was subsequently incubated on a rotary shaker at 150 rpm for 48 h at 28°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ildn","text":"Phytochemical analysis of the AgNPs-Fd was performed using GC–MS (HP-5MS UI, Agilent, USA) to evaluate the chemical compounds that potentially serve as anti-angiogenic.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tiqr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brj7j","text":"For this, samples of AgNPs-Fd were dissolved in ethanol in a microtube, vortexed, and centrifuged for three minutes at 9500 rpm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7192h","text":"The resulting supernatant was used for identification and injected into the GC–MS apparatus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mo9a","text":"The condition of the GC–MS is as follows: column: HP-5MS UI, gas carrier: helium UHP (He), injector temperature: 290℃, split flow: 10 ml/min, split ratio: 10; front inlet flow: 1.00 ml/min, MS transfer line temp: 230℃, ion source temp: 200℃, mass list range (amu): 40–500, purge flow: 3 ml/min, gas saver flow: 5 ml/min, and gas saver time: five minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dak7p","text":"To analyze AgNPs-Fd for anti-angiogenic properties, a CAM assay was performed following previous methods byRibatti [24], Camposano and Torre [28], and Gamallo and Espere [29]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86bdi","text":"Before incubation, eggshells were cleansed with 70% alcohol. The eggs were incubated in for six days at 37−39°C with 50−60% humidity","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75er","text":"A basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF-Thermo Fisher Scientific, USA) is a group of proteins secreted by tissues to regulate cell metabolism, proliferation, differentiation, and survival. The bFGF was used to induce neovascularization[30]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1139m","text":"In total, 24 chicken eggs were collected in preparing for the CAM analysis and were dosed with F. deltoidea extract (Fd) or AgNPs-Fd. The doses used in the paper disk for the CAM assay were as follows: negative control (30 ng basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF); positive control (30 µg cortisone acetate with 30 ng bFGF); treatment groups (30 ng bFGF with AgNPs-Fd at 45, 60, 75 and 90mg, respectively)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":95,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6npde","text":"The boundaries of the air space, which indicated the location of the embryo, were marked on all eggshells with a pencil (1 × 1 cm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvujh","text":"Candling, with egg binoculars, was used to determine the location of the embryo. By using a povidone-iodine solution, the eggshell was cleaned at the pole containing the air space and the part above the embryo","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"sn7q","text":"Using a needle, a small hole was made in the air chamber and vacuumed until the air moved from the pole to the top of the egg.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4e4e1","text":"Next, a window measuring 1 × 1 cm was made on the marked area using a mini drill. Paper discs for each treatment were then embedded onto the CAM through this window","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fd35k","text":"The holes in the polar regions and 1 × 1 cm windows were sealed with paraffin film after they had been planted according to the treatment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s5i1","text":"After, the eggs were removed and subsequently killed by freezing for 24 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6imi","text":"The eggs were then incubated for 48 h at 37−39°C with 50−60% humidity","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2rl0c","text":"The eggs were then opened by cutting the eggshell into two parts, beginning with the part closest to the air cavity","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42ogg","text":"The egg contents were slowly and carefully removed, keeping the CAM attached to the shell. Each CAM was photographed and analyzed using AngioTool 0.6 software","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29c4t","text":"AngioTool is a small, easy-to-use application that allows for the quick, hands-free and reproducible measurement of vascular networks in micrographs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58l9k","text":"AngioTool calculates a variety of morphological and geographical data, such as the area covered by a vascular network, the number of vessels, vessel length, vascular density, and lacunarity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8qv3p","text":"AngioTool also computes the \"branching index\" (branch points/unit area), which quantifies specimen sprouting activity[26].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Antiangiogenic research using AgNPs-FD
